org.apache.sis.referencing.operation.transform

Interface LinearTransform

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MathTransform

    public interface LinearTransform
extends MathTransform
    A MathTransform which convert coordinates using only linear equations. Such transform can be represented by a matrix. Those transforms are often affine, but not necessarily.

    Relationships:

    • The number of columns in the matrix is equal to the number of source dimensions plus 1
    • The number of rows in the matrix is equal to the number of target dimensions plus 1.
    See Also:
    org.apache.sis.referencing.operation.MathTransforms

    Defined in the sis-referencing module

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Matrix getMatrix()
      Returns the coefficients of this linear transform as a matrix.

      • Methods inherited from interface MathTransform

        derivative, getSourceDimensions, getTargetDimensions, inverse, isIdentity, toWKT, transform, transform, transform, transform, transform

    • Method Detail

      • getMatrix

        Matrix getMatrix()
        Returns the coefficients of this linear transform as a matrix. Converting a coordinate with this MathTransform is equivalent to multiplying the returned matrix by a vector containing the ordinate values with an additional 1 in the last row. For example if this transform converts projected coordinates (metres) to display coordinates (pixel), then the same conversions can be done by the returned matrix as below:

        Returns:
        The coefficients of this linear transform as a matrix.
